title: Pan-Seared Chicken with Garlic Parmesan Cream Sauce

ingredients.name: dried thyme or oregano (for chicken, optional)

directions: Pat the chicken dry with a paper towel. Rub with a little oil, then season both sides with salt (1 tsp), black pepper (1/2 tsp), garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and optional thyme or oregano.
Pan-sear the chicken over medium-high heat for 4-5 minutes per side until golden brown and cooked through (internal temp: 165°F). Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, melt butter over medium heat.
Sauté minced garlic for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in heavy cream and stir, scraping up any browned bits from the pan.
Add Parmesan cheese and Italian seasoning, stirring until the cheese melts and the sauce thickens slightly (about 2 minutes).
Season with salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lemon juice if desired.
Serve the sauce over the chicken.
notes: Pairs well with air-fried Parmesan asparagus and mashed potatoes. For a slight kick, add 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper to the chicken seasoning. The sauce is made in the same pan as the chicken to capture the fond (browned bits) for extra flavor.
